author: Luke Dormehl
title: Today in Apple history: John Sculley steps down as Apple CEO
description:
On June 18, 1993, Apple CEO John Sculley gave up the reins after a 10-year run, following a crash in AAPL's stock price.
(via Cult of Mac - Your source for the latest Apple news, rumors, analysis, reviews, how-tos and deals.)
content:
June 18, 1993:John Sculley steps down as Apple CEO after a 10-year run. The Apple board asks Sculley to leave after AAPL shares collapse from a high of $4.33 in 1992 to a measly 73 cents.
